intro: Ficus albipila var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fig, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are typically light green in color. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs that are typically yellow or green. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. This variety is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor environments.
